column1: Male, 50 years old, non-co-pathological, symptomatic for two days, worsening, with dry cough, pyrexia over 38 Â° C, asthenia. 93% pO2 saturation is detected in ambient air.
CLINICAL DIAGNOSTIC PATH: the patient arrives in Radiology on an outpatient basis. Standard chest radiogram and later chest computed/computerized tomography are performed.
The radiological picture is typical for COVID-19 interstitial pneumonia. The patient is accompanied to the emergency room, subjected to a pharyngeal swab and hospitalized for appropriate treatment.
